primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Arriving God' moves from the future into the human 'Valley of Ashes' (the past/death) to seize and rescue a people trapped in illusion and decay.

tekstueel_bewijs: God is on the move toward us
the heralding announcement of the arriving God
we are met by the oncoming Lord
the only One in whom the promise of peace will some day be fulfilled
the great coming day of the kingdom of God
for the mouth of the Lord has spoken
God is out ahead of us
Emmanuel shall come to thee, O Israel
In our valley of ashes, we are seized by hope
the Holy Spirit breathes life from the dead
By thine own eternal Spirit rule in all our hearts
the past is a destroying current
valley of ashes where nothing can grow
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but an ontological 'current' that 'ceaselessly' bears humans back to death and futility.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer to the arriving Kingdom.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / 'We'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is explicitly fueled by the primary: 'Trusting in that promise, we can do things...'

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → The Oncoming Lord ← The Past/Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: God is on the move toward us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we beat on, boats against the current
we try to create artificial worlds

voorbeelden: I’m dreaming of a white Christmas
we recognize that we are hearing something entirely new
we can do things we thought we could not do
Relying on him, we can change

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the endowment of power (Pouvoir) from an external source (God) because the human subject is characterized by 'incapacity'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (The Past) through ~S1 (Sentimentality) to ~S2 (Wilderness/Renunciation) and finally to S1 (The Oncoming Lord).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'countervailing motion' of God who arrives from the future to break the cycle of the past.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the past is described as a 'destroying current' and a 'graveyard'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is rigorously theocentric. It identifies human helplessness and places the agency of rescue entirely on God's 'oncoming' movement.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we can change our habits, confront our addictions...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is on the move toward us, not the other way round.
the past is a destroying current, ready to swallow us up in futility.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (John the Baptist, Mary) are used as recipients of the promise or heralds, not as moral models to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Mary and Zechariah are subjects of God's favor and action.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; the burden of 'making peace' is replaced by the 'arriving peace' of God.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic rescue; the human role is to be 'seized by hope'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the primary program (God's arrival) to the secondary (our response) is perfectly logical: 'Trusting in that promise, we can...'

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the countervailing motion that lifts the boats clear... God is enlisting us on the side of his future.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit 'breathes life' into the 'incapacity' of the hearer.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'destroying current' and 'darkness' that humans cannot escape via 'artificial light'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative. The hearer is positioned as the Receiver in a valley of ashes, waiting for an external rescue.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching. The use of Gatsby as a foil for the 'destroying current' of the past creates a profound need for the 'Oncoming Lord'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the Gatsby metaphor, Greimasian analysis reveals that Gatsby is the 'Opponent' (the past) and God is the 'Subject' (the future).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah 40; semiotics shows how Isaiah 40 functions as a 'Pouvoir-faire' (endowment of power) for the modern hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'ethical list' at the end is not a new mandate (Devoir) but a consequence of the Subject-switch (God taking over the boat).

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's own rule perfectly: God is the subject of the active verbs of salvation.
